reviewText: Neena and Veena are fabulous instructors.  There are three videos included: Basic Dance, Beyond Basic Dance, and Mystic Dance.  If you are deciding between VHS and DVD, I strongly recommend the DVD. The DVD has some great bellydancing extras on it, including some fitness bellydance examples. You can choose having the instructional voice on or off.My one complaint about these videos revolves around the instructional voice, which is not always in sync with what Neena and Veena are currently doing.  If I'm not paying attention, when I'm learning the steps, I can get frustrated by that, as I tend to listen to the voice more. (habit left from dancing and aerobics)I LOVE the videos.  These are the best bellydance instructional videos I've tried.  The camera focus is almost perfect - when small movements are occurring (say with the wrist), it's focussed on the wrist, or if there is a bit of trickier footwork - focus is on the the feet.  Otherwise, it's mostly a whole body shot - which is much better than many of the other bellydancing videos.Instruction starts slow - I like how they teach arm positions for you to be able to experiment.  The progression from slow to tempo does occur a little fast, but it's allowed me more enjoyment of the video because it has been a little more challenging.  It's not too difficult!The steps all come together in the end with a choreographed dance, which is great fun.  The videos definitely build skills from one to the other.  Once you've practiced a few times, and are getting the dance routines down, you will be getting a workout!!  My arms already look totally different, and I have more hip flexibility than I use to.These videos gave me enough experience to feel confident enough after three weeks of (secret) practice to give a dance to my husband.  He thought I'd been taking lessons on my lunch break.  (and no, he's not suave enough to have just come up with that!) :)Fun and energizing exercise, with an element of sensuality - for what more could I ask?
Title: N/A

reviewText: All three of these tapes are just excellent. The first one, 'Basic Dance,' teaches you the basics, 'Beyond Basic Dance' is a little more advanced, and the final tape, 'Mystic Dance,' goes beyond and offers veil instruction. Each tape starts with a great warmup and then isolates upper and lower body movements, demonstrates some steps and then leads the student into a choreographed dance routine with two practice sessions before the twins come out and do the final dance in full costume and to tempo. The production quality is excellent. The camerawork is great. If the twins are showing steps, the camera isn't focusing on their abs or breasts, like some other tapes do. Neena and Veena are also costumed appropriately in leggings and tank tops so you can see what they're doing as they show you the moves. Only at the end do they change into costume for the final dance routine. I own several other tapes by other dancers, and I think this series shows how to do the movements and dance steps most clearly. If I were told I could only keep one bellydance instructional series and to throw out the rest, I'd keep Neena and Veena.

reviewText: I had already written a review on this CD before.  It was probably on another screen.  I am surprised you want another one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I can't say enough good stuff about Veena and Neena's videos. I am just as thrilled with this series as I am with their exercise videos. I am not a quick study when it comes to dance, but I immediately picked up almost every single move in the beginning video -- on the first go-around! They really break down the moves, slowly and clearly, and offer many good tips for executing the moves. Frankly, I learned far more from this video on the first go than I did in a six-week bellydance class at my local community college. FAR more!Unlike the earlier reviewer who regretted purchasing all three videos, I am looking forward to viewing the tape over and over (even though I quickly learned the moves), until I can *move* like the bellytwins when I execute those moves. I am delighted with the series, glad I purchased all three, and would gladly pay twice what I did if I had to replace them. I can only hope Veena and Neena will keep cranking out videos! (Yeah, tapes on how to dance with snakes and swords would be AMAZING!! And how about tapes that teach the choreography for those demo dances?!)...

reviewText: This set is particularly valuable for the beginning dancer who is more interested in learning the technique than in a workout video or weightloss. (Of course it is good for these things, too.) The focus is on teaching the basics of dance and putting everything together into choreographies that you don't mind showing off.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is so far the lowest rating I've EVER given to an item bought on Amazon. I made the mistake to order these DVDs based on other very positive rarings. It was a HUGE mistake. These are the reasons why I gave this set only 2 stars.1. Instructions for dummies is really an overstatement. They go SO slow I get impatient. And I myself enjoy trying and trying until I get it right.2. I would mind them taking it slow if they would just show many things slowly. My greatest and biggest complaint is that these 3 DVDs contain next to nothing, showingly only 35-45 mins of instruction. The best qualification I could give them is empty of content - there is NO substance in them! Imagine, for a whole DVD of instructions they didn't have enough material to put together a routine for ONE whole song. (Well how can you make a decent dance when you've learnt just about 6 moves?!) In other words, these DVDs are NOT good value.3. It's a minor complaint compared to what I said above but I get very irritated by their smile that are just *plastered* on their faces. I never mind smiles but they really overdo it. It just doesn't give you a feeling they are enjoying themselves but posing instead.4. They are so slow and take lots of time to explain to you how to do hip lifts, then they just "forget" to instruct you. I don't mind the I-dance-you-copy style but then you might as well learn by watching a performances.5. I don't mind "extas" on DVDs but I do mind when they comprise 1/3 of the total run time. On each DVD there are several trailers of other products plus performances by other dancers. I love watching performances, don't get me wrong, but when I pay for an instructional DVD I expect to be instructed instead.There are few positive things about the set, so I should point them out too.1. The twins are beautiful. I can't deny them that. I actually have had the privilidge of watching them perform on another DVD set and I can call their performance no less than glorious. They have such impressive routines, including props such as swords, canes and veils. What a shame they show next to nothing of this in this set.2. They have very nice costumes and veils.3. They show VERY few moves but they do spend a lot of time on them, so you can learn them well.4. Production quality is good.IN CONCLUSION:Those who would benefit from these DVDs are *total* beginners who've NEVER bdanced before AND have no lasting interest in learning the depths of it. The third DVD is also good for those who want to learn the BASICS of the veil, so you may want to buy it seperately.I first saw some of these on my cable on demand and back then I thought they were great but now that I have done some research, I can compare the products available. For total beginners I definitely recommend Jenna's Basics for a Solid Foundation and Beyond. Neon's new DVD looks very promising. I don't own Amira's 101 but judging by the reviews it's worth checking out. For those who have some basic bellydance it's a great choice to get Jehan's Sacred Bellydance. For the same price you get THREE hours of wonderful instruction to last you months and months!In other words, before you click the "order" button make sure to consider your options because you CAN get better value for your money than this. I recommend this set only to people without bellydance experience who want to see "what it's all about" without paying a fortune. However, be prepared that if your interest is sparkled, you'll be spending more money soon on other, more substantial DVDs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Veena and Neena are great.  I know more than a few talented young ladies who learned a lot from these courses, and who look better now than I likely ever will.  That said, I personally don't find the tapes (so to speak) appealing now, and I hope that my comments will be taken not so much as a criticism of these fine teachers, as an elucidation of how this course compares to one of the other styles that is out there, and hopefully the reader will find it helpful in confirming their choice of styles.These videos assume very little past experience with belly dance, and they teach a routine, element by element.  I don't like dance or exercise classes that are geared towards learning one specific routine.  I'd rather learn the bodywork and the overall feel.  It seems like that is the standard way that these kind of classes are done, however -- sort of like working towards a performance or something.Their style is pretty and sweet, and their makeup is non-threatening, but for me the pace was too slow (as I do have some experience in this, even if I'm not very good it has been a hobby for 20 years or so) and kind of bland.If you want a pleasant introduction, I think Veena and Neena are very nice.But if you want something a little more edgy, like you've been looking at "tribal" or "fusion" style belly dance, this might not be for you.
summary: Standard bellydance fare -- good for some, but not all there is
Title: N/A

reviewerName: E. L. White "member of the 3AM Zill Brigade"
reviewText: May be the best you can get short of classes.I live in an area that up until a few months ago had no middle eastern dance instructors within less than a 1 hour radius. Since I didn't have a car, I couldn't take the weekly classes one hour away or more. I had only taken one, four hour workshop and had a few lessons from my friend and her mother previous to getting this set. Veena and Neena really helped me out. The warm-ups were relaxing and easy and once you got to learning the moves each one was shown briefly so you could see what you were going to learn, then broken down, then repeated at an increasing pace. I found that the voice over made it easier to concentrate than having them talk to you directly, as specialy because there were two of them and switching around would have been distracting. At the end of each tape you are taught a simple choreography which is first broken down, then rehearsed at it's normal pace with the music, and lastly Veena and Neena perform it in costume. I liked the music, which I don't think sounded like porn music or whatever that other person said. It sounded middle eastern, and the tempo of the music always matched what was going on and set a pace for you. Overall I thought the videos were not too short or too long and easy to learn with practice.A few months later I was pulled up to dance with dancer Suspira at the Marakesh. After her show she came to my table and complimented me, and even seemed amazed that most of what I learned was through videos! When I began classes a few months after that, my teacher was also impressed and I found that the moves being taught in class were easy to learn because I already knew the basics and was already loose and flexible, which is difficult for most beginners because they are not used to moving that way. This set is a good jump start, but if you want to go anywhere with bellydance make sure to take classes.

reviewText: Just got my DVDs in the mail and within hours I was shimmying my ass off! I first found some of their choreography on YouTube, and after trying out a couple of their videos I found that I could follow them quite well and also that I found that their  "Twin Power" was very helpful, they both show the same movements but aren't exactly the same. Which is very helpful because it shows that each movement doesn't need to be exactly the same way. And that's how I found myself here purchasing these DVDs that I have found to be worth the search. I've been wanting to learn how to belly dance for a while now and I think that I have found the perfect Teachers!I just can't wait to see where I will be by disc three!.

reviewText: I bought this DVD because I am out of shape, need exercise, and need to start somewhere. I found this to be fun and I can go at my own pace! I would recommend it for anyone who doesn't want to go to the gym, run, jog, play sports, etc. etc. It is a very feminine, graceful way to exercise! I hate exercise and if you do, too, you'll love these DVDs. It's not like exercise, it's fun!

reviewText: If you're taking or have been taking bellydance classes, you may find the routines very basic and maybe a little boring.  However, the special features of other bellydancers are great.  I feel that Veena and Neena are good instructors and that this set provides the "bare bones" of bellydance.  Like I said, if you're in classes you've probably worked on these moves already although they don't hurt to have around as practice drills.  If you are a beginner and don't know where to look, this is for you because this will give you a great running knowledge easily and effectively.  Again, just make sure you look at the special features to see how these basic moves can be built upon.As a personal sidenote, my only complaint is that their routines are specifically tailored to the one song that they have chosen instead of explaining how each move can be used for different elements of other songs.  If you were to learn the routine but don't have the song that they used, you really can't perform it in real life. The real spirit of bellydance is being able to interpret any kind of music with the techniques and moves that you learn.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD collection is so much fun to perform.  It takes you into the intricate details of the mechanics of bellydance and really shows you how to perform it correctly.  And Veena and Neena make it so much fun.  I enjoy listening to them instruct, they make it look so easy and make you want to learn more.  The different styles of dance they show you makes it even more fun to play up the styles for many things, such as a romantic evening or at a party if you feel up to it!!!Thanks
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have two of the videos in this set, but, I think I can still write a review based on them.I have Basic Dance and Mystical Dance. I enjoy both tapes, although, I find Mystic Dance easier to follow. I think it's because the movements on that tape are slower and more sensuous. The routine you learn on the Basic Dance tape is fast and sort of perky (well, as "perky" as belly dancing gets). I'm just not confident enough in my movements to go that quickly.But, I do enjoy both tapes and the instructional methods in both of them. Neena and Veena are excellent instructors, who clearly and carefully demonstrate each movement. The sound quality is also excellent. Both music and voice-overs for instruction are bright and audible.I'm really looking forward to being able to afford "Beyond Mystic Dance", although, I'm saving to get the whole set on DVD.

reviewText: Neena and Veena may not be looked at too greatly in the dance community for being 'Hollywood', but you know what? Who cares. This is a great way to start learning some moves for the dance. I later saw that the twins were not the norm as far as dancing, looks, or production of movies go, but that's only because I threw myself into dancing and bought many other titles and attended classes. However, they do not deserve the bad rep they are getting by many. This boxed set was the first thing I replaced when my car was broken into and many of my things were stolen. It;s a wonderful set, very much so worth the money. Perfect for those who need a instant self esteem boost.I cannot say enough good things about this set. Classes are best, but this set is number 2 in my opinion.Shimmy on!

reviewText: First off, I have to say, THESE ARE NOT EXERSIZE DVDs. At least, not at first. Sure, once you've learned them all and can do the dances, I suppose it is exersize. And all movement is really some kind of exersize, right? But these DVDs are not designed to help you lose weight, or even become more flexible, or whatever- they are designed to teach you how to dance belly-dance.That said, if you want to learn how to belly-dance, these are fantastic. The two dancers are great, and it starts out slow, building to more complicated moves. My only complaints- yea, the voiceover is lousy (but once you've gone through the dvd a few times to get the gist, you can turn her off) and when they put the moves together at the end, they put ALL the  moves together at the end, instead of building one on another and then starting over to build another. But that's what pause and rewind are for- so if you do want to learn, this is the set to get.

reviewText: I'm a beginner at Belly dance and was looking for some DVD's for it. I got this one and Belly dance for beginners from Leila of Cairo. Although these dvds aren't as good as Belly Dance for beginners, I do really like them! They are pretty easy and enjoyable for someone new at Belly dance. Veena and Neena explain the moves slowly, even on the "beyond basic dance" DVD, they still go very slowly. I only wish these DVDs were longer and taught more moves but I think their very good for a beginner and for someone who has no experience with dance at all. One thing I really like on the DVD's are the bonus performances which show different styles of Belly dance. Anyway I really do like this DVDS and I think they are fun to do, but it won't teach you very much, however they are still fun.

reviewText: What a marvellous box set and certainly a must for aspiring bellydancers out there. I have only recently started taking bellydancing classes and I have found these videos very helpful in practicing what I have learnt during class. Neena and Veena's gorgeous smiles, fluid movements and beautiful figures are inspirational.Despite what other reviewers have suggested, the use of a voice over, rather than Neena and Veena speaking (they just smile gracefully) is not off-putting at all. I am far too busy concentrating on the movements to find it at all disconcerting. In fact, I think it works far better than if they were to personally talk the student through the steps.I do hope Neena and Veena produce a video for more advanced students soon!

reviewText: I discovered Neena & Veena on Youtube and liked the exercises.  Since I was new to bellydance, I started with Bellydance Fitness for Beginners DVD for the workout and am glad I did.  What I like about the triplevideo, Discover Bellydance, is what you don't get in the workout - choreography! Also have the beginner's bellydance with Leila; this is a good companion piece to learn the moves slowly and thoroughly.  The twins don't spend much time on the various moves, so you have to back up and watch again. I do have some dance background, which helps. Some of the questions I had from Bellydance Fitness were answered in Discover Bellydance. The beginner's DVD with Luscious is another companion piece.  I found it helpful to see different teachers explain the same move.  All in all, I'm very happy with the twins.  There are some additional performances by others at the end which are interesting.

reviewText: I love Neena and Veena's videos and they are really great for exercise and really give the body and muscles a workout. I know of someone who actually lost 100 lbs. by changing her eating and using these as exercise and in the process became a really good belly dancer. I've seen some feedback about the moves having too much hand and veil work for it to feel like a true exercise video, etc. One thing you have to understand is that the Belly Twins are first and foremost, Belly Dancers and that is what they do and teach; they aren't exercise instructors. Most beginner Belly Dancers buy these videos to learn the basic moves and novice/inter. moves because they can't afford classes 3 or 4 times a week and if your in California, you can't afford Veena and Neena! lol! Don't get me wrong, these are great for getting the blood pumping, the sweat going and muscles toning to lose weight but if that is the only reason you are buying them, you may be somewhat disappointed if you expect instructed "Jane Fonda-ish" type videos. These videos are really primarily to TEACH Belly dance moves and sequences. Even the exercise videos are really just for making sure you don't injure yourself doing the moves of belly dancing. If you want to learn how to do authentic Belly Dance moves, impress your friends and yourself, or seduce your man or just plain have fun, these are perfect for that. If you want just a exercise video for losing weight, these are probably not the ones for you. Sorry. I love these videos because they are fun, I've always wanted to learn to Belly Dance AND I really need a fun way to exercise to lose weight. I plan on continuing in Belly Dance once I feel more confident, lose some serious weight, and can find a good instructor that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. LOL!
summary: For exercise its great! But this is really a bellydance video

reviewText: Perfect for the first-timer.  Their form is something for any dancer to aspire to.  Elegant arms at all times.  Very slow and dissected moves- NOT a workout dvd.I thought it a bummer that the dvd did not end in a complete routine for all of the time spent... the routine they teach does not last the length of one song so it doesn't supply the gratification of learning a choreography you could show off or anything...it is like a teaser to bellydance.  If you enjoy these dvds- anticipate the inevitable: you will be spending more money very soon.

reviewText: My wife just loves these, as it starts to show you actual dancing styles over just the basic moves of the other DVD's.She hasn't had a lot of time to practice them but she's happy I got them for her.I can't give a more complete rebview yet because she has only done them a few times but overall she's very happy now getting into the actual dancing and not just the basic moves.Still neither of us see this as real exercise but she has fun doing it and it's not easy and it does take time to learn.There might be better tutorials out there but you have to like teh style of dance and that is where Neena and Veena shine.They really do need to make it more of a tutorial style but other than that we are very happy with these.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a wonderful set for someone completely new to bellydancing!! I bought this set after being exposed to arabic dancing from arabic friends so the first one was pretty easy for me. The difference, though, is when I dance with my friends we did not just focus on one move at a time, we just danced away. In the second tape the chest moves and hip moves really toned me up because you do strictly those moves a few minutes at a time. I love them!! On my sides where I used to be able to pinch fat has disappeared!!  I am so happy. The third tape is killer on the arms!! The turns, though, are too much for me. Even with spotting I get very dizzy so I just skip that part but I can do the turns in the choreographed dance. The voice-over did not bother me, and neither did their "frozen" smiles on their faces like it did some others. They really do break down the moves and teach you beginners belly dance!!  I must say, now, though, I use Suzanna DelVecchio's tapes for advanced instruction since I would say I am an advanced dancer.  But those Sensual Tapes really helped me polish and tone to be able to get more advanced!!  I love the way belly dance makes me feel so sensual and sexy!!

reviewText: Neena & Veena are my favorite bellydancer instructors. Dolphina the Goddess Workouts are good too, but Rania is way too stiff/robotic.The pace is a bit slow, but they are good at putting an interesting & challenging but not too hard routine together. I started & liked their aerobics DVDs "Bellydance Fitness for Beginners" first.They still have the best humor in the voice overs, most relaxed & playful then all the other instructors out there. This is what really makes you want to dance & have fun.You can see previews of this dvd & their other ones atcollagevideo comyoutube com under the titles of their dvds, "belly dance twins" or "Neena & Veena"
summary: I love it like everyone else
